title: Classic Vacuum Cleaners
description: From door-to-door salesmen to canister models, test your vacuum cleaner memories

questions.question: Which vacuum cleaner brand was famous for its door-to-door salesmen who would demonstrate the product in your home?
What type of vacuum cleaner design, with a separate canister connected to the wand by a hose, became popular in the 1950s?
Which brand coined the slogan 'It beats, as it sweeps, as it cleans' for its upright vacuum cleaners?
What household cleaning tool did the vacuum cleaner largely replace in American homes?
What was a common problem with early vacuum cleaner bags that homemakers dealt with regularly?
options: They had to be emptied and reused
They were hard to find in stores

questions.question: Which vacuum brand, founded in 1919 in Bloomington, Illinois, became famous for its heavy-duty, multi-purpose home cleaning systems?
What feature did the Hoover 'Constellation' model, introduced in 1955, use to move across the floor?
options: A cushion of exhaust air that let it float

questions.question: Before disposable bags, what did many homemakers have to do with the vacuum's cloth dust bag?
options: Take it outside, empty it, and shake it out

questions.question: What brand of carpet sweeper, requiring no electricity, was a common sight in homes before vacuum cleaners became affordable?
What was the built-in vacuum system that some upscale homes featured, with outlets in various rooms connected to a central unit?
Which lightweight handheld vacuum, introduced by Black & Decker in 1979, became a sensation for quick cleanups?
What did the headlight on the front of many upright vacuum cleaners help homeowners do?
options: Signal when the bag was full
See dirt under furniture and in dark corners
Show when the belt needed replacing

questions.question: What popular attachment, included with many canister vacuums, was designed specifically for cleaning upholstered furniture?
In Britain, the Hoover brand became so dominant that the act of vacuuming became known by what term?
What did the distinctive smell of many vintage vacuum cleaners come from?
options: The heated rubber belt and dust bag
